template.name: MongoDB cluster by Zabbix agent 2
template.description:
Get MongoDB metrics from plugin for the zabbix-agent2. 1. Setup and configure zabbix-agent2 compiled with the MongoDB monitoring plugin. 2. Set the {$MONGODB.CONNSTRING} such as <protocol(host:port)> or named session. 3. Set the user name and password in host macros ({$MONGODB.USER}, {$MONGODB.PASSWORD}) if you want to override parameters from the Zabbix agent configuration file.
All sharded Mongodb nodes (mongod) will be discovered with attached template "MongoDB node".
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/420659-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-db-mongodb
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Configserver heartbeat
item.description: Difference between the latest optime of the CSRS primary that the mongos has seen and cluster time.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Connection pool: available
item.description: The total number of available outgoing connections from the current mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Connection pool: client connections
item.description: The number of active and stored outgoing synchronous connections from the current mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Connection pool: created, rate
item.description: The total number of outgoing connections created per second by the current mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Connection pool: in use
item.description: Reports the total number of outgoing connections from the current mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster set that are currently in use.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Connection pool: refreshing
item.description: Reports the total number of outgoing connections from the current mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster that are currently being refreshed.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Connection pool: scoped
item.description: Number of active and stored outgoing scoped synchronous connections from the current mongos instance to other members of the sharded cluster.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Connections, active
item.description: "The number of active client connections to the server. Active client connections refers to client connections that currently have operations in progress. Available starting in 4.0.7, 0 for older versions."

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Connections, available
item.description: "The number of unused incoming connections available."

trigger.event_name: MongoDB cluster: Available connections less then {$MONGODB.CONNS.AVAILABLE.MIN.WARN}
trigger.name: MongoDB cluster: Available connections is low
trigger.description: "Too few available connections. Consider this value in combination with the value of connections current to understand the connection load on the database"

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Connections, current
item.description: "The number of incoming connections from clients to the database server. This number includes the current shell session"

item.name: MongoDB cluster: New connections, rate
item.description: "Rate of all incoming connections created to the server."

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Get mongodb.connpool.stats
item.description: Returns current info about connpool.stats.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Cursor: open pinned
item.description: Number of pinned open cursors.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Cursor: open total
item.description: Number of cursors that MongoDB is maintaining for clients.

trigger.event_name: MongoDB cluster: Too many cursors opened by MongoDB for clients (over {$MONGODB.CURSOR.OPEN.MAX.WARN} in 5m)
trigger.name: MongoDB cluster: Too many cursors opened by MongoDB for clients

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Cursor: timed out, rate
item.description: Number of cursors that time out, per second.

trigger.event_name: MongoDB cluster: Too many cursors are timing out (over {$MONGODB.CURSOR.TIMEOUT.MAX.WARN} per second in 5m)
trigger.name: MongoDB cluster: Too many cursors are timing out

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Jumbo chunks
item.description: Total number of 'jumbo' chunks in the mongo cluster.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Last seen configserver
item.description: The latest optime of the CSRS primary that the mongos has seen.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Architecture
item.description: A number, either 64 or 32, that indicates whether the MongoDB instance is compiled for 64-bit or 32-bit architecture.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Memory: resident
item.description: Amount of memory currently used by the database process.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Memory: virtual
item.description: Amount of virtual memory used by the mongos process.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Cursor: open no timeout
item.description: Number of open cursors with the option DBQuery.Option.noTimeout set to prevent timeout after a period of inactivity.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Bytes in, rate
item.description: The total number of bytes that the server has received over network connections initiated by clients or other mongod/mongos instances per second.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Bytes out, rate
item.description: The total number of bytes that the server has sent over network connections initiated by clients or other mongod/mongos instances per second.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Requests, rate
item.description: Number of distinct requests that the server has received per second

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Operations: command
item.description: "The number of commands issued to the database per second. Counts all commands except the write commands: insert, update, and delete."

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Operations: delete
item.description: The number of delete operations the mongos instance per second.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Operations: getmore, rate
item.description: "The number of “getmore” operations the mongos per second. This counter can be high even if the query count is low. Secondary nodes send getMore operations as part of the replication process."

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Operations: insert, rate
item.description: The number of insert operations received the mongos instance per second.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Operations: query, rate
item.description: The number of queries received the mongos instance per second.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Operations: update, rate
item.description: The number of update operations the mongos instance per second.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Ping
item.description: Test if a connection is alive or not.

trigger.name: MongoDB cluster: Connection to mongos proxy is unavailable
trigger.description: Connection to mongos proxy instance is currently unavailable.

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Get server status
item.description: The mongos statistic

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Uptime
item.description: Number of seconds since Mongos server start

trigger.event_name: MongoDB cluster: Failed to fetch info data (or no data for 10m)
trigger.name: MongoDB cluster: Failed to fetch info data
trigger.description: Zabbix has not received data for items for the last 10 minutes

dependency.name: MongoDB cluster: Connection to mongos proxy is unavailable

item.name: MongoDB cluster: Mongos version
item.description: Version of the Mongos server

trigger.event_name: MongoDB cluster: Version has changed (new version: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.expression: last(/MongoDB cluster by Zabbix agent 2/mongodb.version,#1)<>last(/MongoDB cluster by Zabbix agent 2/mongodb.version,#2) and length(last(/MongoDB cluster by Zabbix agent 2/mongodb.version))>0
trigger.name: MongoDB cluster: Version has changed
trigger.description: MongoDB cluster version has changed. Ack to close.

macro.description: Connection string in the URI format (password is not used).

discovery_rule.name: Collection discovery
discovery_rule.description: Collect collections metrics. Note, depending on the number of DBs and collections this discovery operation may be expensive. Use filters with macros {$MONGODB.LLD.FILTER.DB.MATCHES}, {$MONGODB.LLD.FILTER.DB.NOT_MATCHES}, {$MONGODB.LLD.FILTER.COLLECTION.MATCHES}, {$MONGODB.LLD.FILTER.COLLECTION.NOT_MATCHES}.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}: Objects, avg size
item_prototype.description: The size of the average object in the collection in bytes.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}: Capped
item_prototype.description: Whether or not the collection is capped.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}: Objects, count
item_prototype.description: Total number of objects in the collection.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}: Capped, max size
item_prototype.description: Maximum size of a capped collection in bytes.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}: Capped, max number
item_prototype.description: Maximum number of documents in a capped collection.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}: Indexes
item_prototype.description: Total number of indices on the collection.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}: Size
item_prototype.description: The total size in bytes of the data in the collection plus the size of every indexes on the mongodb.collection.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}: Get collection stats {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}
item_prototype.description: Returns a variety of storage statistics for a given collection.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}.{#COLLECTION}: Storage size
item_prototype.description: Total storage space allocated to this collection for document storage.

discovery_rule.name: Database discovery
discovery_rule.description: Collect database metrics. Note, depending on the number of DBs this discovery operation may be expensive. Use filters with macros {$MONGODB.LLD.FILTER.DB.MATCHES}, {$MONGODB.LLD.FILTER.DB.NOT_MATCHES}.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}: Size, data
item_prototype.description: Total size of the data held in this database including the padding factor.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}: Extents
item_prototype.description: Contains a count of the number of extents in the database across all collections.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}: Size, file
item_prototype.description: Total size of the data held in this database including the padding factor (only available with the mmapv1 storage engine).

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}: Size, index
item_prototype.description: Total size of all indexes created on this database.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}: Objects, count
item_prototype.description: Number of objects (documents) in the database across all collections.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}: Objects, avg size
item_prototype.description: The average size of each document in bytes.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}: Get db stats {#DBNAME}
item_prototype.description: Returns statistics reflecting the database system's state.

item_prototype.name: MongoDB {#DBNAME}: Size, storage
item_prototype.description: Total amount of space allocated to collections in this database for document storage.

macro.description: Connection string in the URI format (password is not used).

Connection string in the URI format (password is not used). This param overwrites a value configured in the "Server" option of the configuration file (if it's set), otherwise, the plugin's default value is used: "tcp://localhost:27017"
Maximum number of cursors timing out per second
